title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, April 11, 1864
summary: Nadenbousch responds to his wife's worries regarding confiscation of their property by Federal soldiers. He assures his wife he has enough money to sustain the family, and to not worry too much if some property is lost. He also complains about his loneliness and his suffering from rheumatism. He urges his wife to come to Staunton if things become too difficult at home.
keywords: Family, Home Front, Medicine/Hospitals, Military Authority, Women, American Civil War
